title: (x) Looking for a font (half blackletter half sans) – The Royal Family, Fraktendon {Nina, Corey, Rainer}
content:
I spotted this font somewhere on the web. I am certain it wasn't custom but a font. The letters were divided horizontally, the top half was a sans face while the bottom half was blackletter. It sounds terrible, I know, but it kinda worked. Anyway, if anyone knows what I am talking about....

THANKS
author: thompson

comments.content:
Sounds like the font in this book cover that Hrant posted to Flickr recently…  
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/48413419@N00/4083262866/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130908162807/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/48413419@N00/4083262866/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/48413419@N00/4083262866/")  
That font isn't available anymore (see [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20130908162807/http:/typographica.org/000629.php)), but maybe somebody else knows of something similar?

You might also like: Fraktendon.  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/volcano/fraktendon/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130908162807/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/volcano/fraktendon/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/volcano/fraktendon/")

Sounds like Royal Family designed by Patrick Giasson, distributed through Thirst.  
I don't believe it is commercially available anymore though :(

Maybe it wasn't a Sans but Clarendon: [Fraktendon](http://web.archive.org/web/20130908162807/http:/www.volcano-type.de/fonts/categories/blackletter/fraktendon) was featured in the T26 October newsletter.
